intro: Solanum memaoyanum, commonly known as the Memaoyan pepper, is a species native to China, specifically the Yunnan province. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its small, red berries that resemble peppercorns. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and star-shaped, and it produces fruit that is used in traditional Chinese medicine and as a spice. The botanical features of Solanum memaoyanum make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and pharmacological study.
